name: Baker, John Solari
title: Investment Adviser Representative
notes: Also registered with BCW Securities LLC (Westport, CT). Registered investment adviser in San Francisco, CA (38 Keyes Avenue, Suite 200).

name: Bethards, Jack M.
title: Chairman and Tonal Advisor
ngos: Associated Pipe Organ Builders of America (past president); American Institute of Organbuilders; International Society of Organbuilders; American Guild of Organists; Organ Historical Society (National Council); Association Aristide Cavaille-Coll
notes: Purchased Schoenstein & Co. in 1977; internationally known pipe organ consultant and tonal designer. Holds BA and MA from UC Berkeley. Clients include Boston Symphony Orchestra, Kennedy Center, and Washington National Cathedral.

name: Bodine, Murray G.
title: Managing Director
ngos: San Francisco Golf Club (former President); The First Tee (former Board Member)
notes: Previously held positions at RBC Capital Markets. Based in Minneapolis, MN. Attended Babson College.

name: Brooks, T. Anthony
title: Managing Director
notes: Full name Tristam Anthony Brooks. Born September 16, 1939 in Summit, NJ. Yale University BA 1962. U.S. Navy Lieutenant (j.g.) 1962-1964. Career: First Boston Corporation VP (1964-1973); Loeb Rhoades & Company Partner (1973-1977); Salomon Brothers Managing Director (1977 onward). Republican. Listed in Marquis Who's Who.

name: Burch, Roger A.
title: Founder and Chief Executive Officer
notes: CEO of Pacific States Industries and its subsidiary Redwood Empire Wholesale Lumber Products. Former police officer in San Mateo County before entering the timber business. The Burch family owns timberland spanning five California counties and three mills, including approximately 30,000 acres near the Gualala River acquired in 2015.

name: Galante, Edward Elio
title: Chairman of the Board
ngos: Northeastern University Board of Trustees (Vice Chairman); LSU Foundation National Board; United Way Foundation of Metropolitan Dallas (board); Artis-Naples (board)
notes: Former Senior Vice President and Management Committee member, Exxon Mobil Corporation (2001-2006); retired after 34 years with ExxonMobil. Also serves as Lead Independent Director, Clean Harbors Inc.; Independent Director, Marathon Petroleum Corp. Born in Inwood, NY; BS Civil Engineering, Northeastern University, 1973. Responsible at ExxonMobil for worldwide Downstream business including Refining & Supply, Fuels Marketing, Lubricants, and corporate Public Affairs.

name: Hachman, Timothy Dervia Musto
title: Owner / General Building Contractor
notes: Hachman Properties Inc. located at 3100 Kerner Blvd, San Rafael, CA. California Contractors State License Board license #829692. Also licensed as a real estate agent in San Rafael (license #01205799).

name: Hanes, Eldridge C.
title: Retired Chairman
ngos: University of North Carolina School of the Arts (former Chairman); American Arts Alliance (former Vice Chairman); American Federation of the Arts; North Carolina Writers Network; North American Wildlife Foundation (board); Trout Unlimited (board); North Carolina Zoo (board); Fuqua School of Business at Duke University (board, 25 years)
notes: Born Winston-Salem, NC. Duke University BA Economics 1967. U.S. Army Bronze Star, served in Vietnam. Worked 7 years at Hanes Corporation knitwear division; founded Xpres Corporation; merged with Encore to form Encore Group (1999); Chairman of The Russ Companies (formed 2008 after Encore acquired Russ Berrie gift divisions); retired 2011. Also an author; published novels Billy Bowater and Justice by Another Name.

name: Heafey, Matt
title: Realtor
notes: Fourth-generation Bay Area native of Oakland and Piedmont. Spent 20 years in institutional fixed income finance before transitioning to real estate in 2005. Specializes in Piedmont, Rockridge, Montclair, and Temescal communities in Oakland/East Bay area.

name: Klebahn, Hugh W.
title: Chairman and Chief Executive Officer
notes: Former Chairman and CEO of Grove Farm Company, Inc., a major landowner on Kauai, Hawaii. Klebahn is a Wilcox family descendant and company shareholder. San Francisco resident who oversaw Grove Farm's transition and sale to Steve Case's entities in 2000-2001.

name: Larsen, Niels Theodore III
title: Chief Executive Officer
notes: CEO of Antioch Building Materials, Co., a family-owned business since 1950 specializing in Ready Mix Concrete, Asphalt, Rock and Sand. Located in Pittsburg and Brentwood, California, serving the Greater Bay Area and Central Valley.

name: Moore, Thomas W. Jr.
title: Retired Television Executive
notes: Career in television: began selling radio advertising in Los Angeles while attending night school at USC; joined ABC network in New York as VP of Sales (1957); rose to President of the ABC Television Network by 1968. Left ABC to co-found Ticketron; later founded Tomorrow Entertainment, producing television classics including The Autobiography of Miss Jane Pittman and Body Human. Received Horatio Alger Award (1968).

name: Motlow, John Geoffrey
notes: Also known as Geoff G. Motlow and John MacOndray Motlow. San Francisco, CA resident; previously lived in Crested Butte CO, Calistoga CA, Berkeley CA, and Santa Cruz CA. Member of the Motlow family connected to the Jack Daniel's whiskey distillery legacy.

name: Munsell, James F.
title: Member
ngos: American Bar Association; New York State Bar Association; New York City Bar Association; Commercial Bar Association of London (Overseas Member)
notes: Also Senior Counsel at Cleary Gottlieb Steen & Hamilton LLP (New York office), where he joined in 1969 and became partner in 1976. Practice focuses on M&A, joint ventures, restructurings, and capital markets. Resident in London office (1973-1977) and Hong Kong office (1980-1983). Education: Cornell University (Engineering Physics, with distinction); Harvard Law School (LL.B., cum laude); Columbia University (MA, International Affairs).

name: O'Malley, Peter
title: Part-Owner (Minority Owner)
ngos: Jackie Robinson Foundation (board member, 30+ years); Little League Foundation (longtime Chairman); Historic Dodgertown (Chairman, 2012-2018)
notes: Born December 12, 1937 in Brooklyn, NY. University of Pennsylvania / Wharton School, 1960. Owner (1979-1998) and President (1970-1998) of the Los Angeles Dodgers; won 1981 and 1988 World Championships, nine postseason appearances. Sold team to Fox Entertainment Group for $311 million (1998). Part-owner of San Diego Padres since 2012. Former Chairman, Historic Dodgertown, Vero Beach, FL (2012-2018), before MLB renamed the site Jackie Robinson Training Complex (2019). Received Tommy Lasorda Award for promoting baseball in Latin America (2010).

name: Pickering, Frederick B. Jr.
title: Investment Adviser
notes: Frederick Butterfield Pickering Jr. Registered as an investment adviser with the SEC (IAPD record #2357935). Voter registration in Stamford, Connecticut.

name: Poett, Henry Williams III
notes: Member of the historic Poett family of the San Francisco Peninsula. Genealogical records trace the family to Alfred Poett (1839-1910), engineer for the Central Pacific Railroad.

name: Roizen, Michael F. M.D.
title: Chief Wellness Officer; Chair, Wellness Institute (founding, 2007-2017)
ngos: RealAge Inc. (Scientific Advisory Board Chair and co-founder); Sharecare (Chief Medical Officer)
notes: Born January 7, 1946. Williams College BA 1967; UCSF School of Medicine MD. Residency at Harvard's Beth Israel Hospital. Former Chair, Department of Anesthesia and Critical Care and Pain Management, University of Chicago (16 years). Appointed first Chief Wellness Officer in a major U.S. healthcare institution in 2007. Author/co-author of five #1 New York Times bestsellers including the RealAge series; co-writes daily newspaper column with Mehmet Oz syndicated to 100+ newspapers. Co-inventor of methylnaltrexone (Relistor). 165 peer-reviewed publications, 14 US patents, started six companies.

name: Runnels, G. Tyler
title: Chairman and Chief Executive Officer
ngos: Coda Octopus Group Inc. (Independent Director); Pepperdine University President's Campaign Cabinet
notes: Chairman and CEO of T.R. Winston & Company, boutique investment bank, since 2003 (with firm since 1990). Nearly 30 years of investment banking experience including debt/equity financings, M&A, IPOs, and restructurings across healthcare, oil and gas, tech, and manufacturing sectors. Prior role: Senior VP of Corporate Finance, H.J. Meyers & Company. Also served on boards of Lilis Energy Inc. and cbdMD Inc. B.S. and MBA from Pepperdine University; holds FINRA Series 7, 24, 55, 63 and 79 licenses.

name: Trotter, Tracy L. MD.
title: Senior Partner
ngos: American Academy of Pediatrics (Fellow; Committee on Genetics contributor); Secretary's Advisory Committee on Heritable Disorders in Newborns and Children (contributor)
notes: Board-certified pediatrician in San Ramon, CA with over 51 years of experience. Wake Forest University School of Medicine, 1974. Residency in Pediatrics at Barrow Neurological Institute, St Joseph's Hospital and Medical Center (1974-1977). Hospital affiliations: John Muir Medical Center Walnut Creek; San Ramon Regional Medical Center. Contributed to AAP Medical Genetics in Pediatric Practice and national newborn screening policy guidelines. Speaks Spanish.

name: Volk, David R. Volk, Richard R.
notes: Name as listed appears to combine two individuals: David R. Volk and Richard R. Volk. David Volk is associated with Castle Creek Capital LLC (managing principal) and serves as independent director of California BanCorp (BCAL); B.S. Santa Clara University; M.S. University of Virginia. Richard R. Volk could not be confirmed from public sources.
